meanings.definition: Put (someone or something) into a situation in which there is a danger of loss, harm, or failure.
meanings.sent1: Leaving the door unlocked jeopardizes our safety.
meanings.sent2: Speeding on the road jeopardizes lives.
meanings.sent3: Forgetting to bring an umbrella jeopardizes our dry clothes.
meanings.sent4: Ignoring climate change jeopardizes the future of our planet.
meanings.sent5: Not wearing a helmet while biking jeopardizes your head's protection.

meanings.sent1: Eating expired food jeopardizes your health.
meanings.sent2: Not wearing a seatbelt jeopardizes your safety in a car.
meanings.sent3: Playing with fire jeopardizes your fingers getting burned.
meanings.sent4: Skipping meals jeopardizes your energy levels.
meanings.sent5: Ignoring warning signs jeopardizes your well-being.
